intro: Symphyllanthus glaber, commonly known as the smooth symphyllanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its simple, smooth-stemmed structure and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to drought conditions. Symphyllanthus glaber is primarily of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
